channel.title: Client Compile Fix {NEED HELP FAST}
channel.description:
Ok so My server is ready to put up and along i have my client So my client is auto iped (317) and it set to 127.0.0.1 and i need to change it to my ip so when i did i saved it but when i compile i get this message
Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with Xlint:deprecation for details. Finished! Press any Key To Continue.
Why isnt this working?? here is my compile note @echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit
I HAVE ALSO TRIED TO USE THIS BUT WHEN I DO IT SAYS NOT RECOGNIZED AS AN INTERNET OR EXTEERNAL COMAND
@echo off title Compile "C:\Program File\\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin pause

item.title: Client Compile Fix {NEED HELP FAST}
item.dc:creator: @demonlover14 demonlover14
item.description:
@demonlover14 wrote:

It’s compleltly fine, that just tells you it has worked…

Read full topic

item.title: Client Compile Fix {NEED HELP FAST}
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

Nothing is wrong with your compiler. The ‘Note:’ just means you’ve done it correctly.

Read full topic

item.description:
@sponge_bong wrote:

lol that message you get from the compiler means it worked… LOL.

item.title: Client Compile Fix {NEED HELP FAST}
item.dc:creator: @mithpkz mithpkz
item.description:
@mithpkz wrote:

Ok so My server is ready to put up and along i have my client So my client is auto iped (317) and it set to 127.0.0.1 and i need to change it to my ip so when i did i saved it but when i compile i get this message

Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with Xlint:deprecation for details.
Finished!
Press any Key To Continue.

Why isnt this working?? here is my compile note
@echo off
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

I HAVE ALSO TRIED TO USE THIS BUT WHEN I DO IT SAYS NOT RECOGNIZED AS AN INTERNET OR EXTEERNAL COMAND

@echo off
title Compile
"C:\Program File\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin
pause

Read full topic
